Introduction

We are seeking 10+ years experienced candidates for a GIS Architect role to design and govern geospatial architecture for a mission-critical enterprise platform.

Job Description

The GIS Architect will: - Define and govern geospatial architecture for ArcGIS Enterprise, geodatabases, and GIS services across multiple data centers and a DR site. - Modernize legacy GIS components into a scalable, high-availability platform. - Collaborate with application, database, infrastructure, and operations teams to ensure accurate, performant, and reliable mapping and spatial analysis. - Design standards for spatial data modeling, replication strategies, and security protocols. - Provide technical leadership to GIS developers and administrators.

Core Responsibilities

  • Define GIS architecture for ArcGIS Enterprise components, ensuring scalability, high availability, and security.
  • Modernize legacy GIS implementations into a modern ArcGIS Enterprise landscape.
  • Design GIS services for web, desktop, mobile, and control-room applications with consistent APIs and cartographic standards.
  • Collaborate with teams to integrate GIS services into business modules (e.g., call taking, dispatch).
  • Establish spatial data modeling standards for routing, proximity analysis, and spatial queries.
  • Ensure active-active data center and DR support via replication and failover strategies.
  • Optimize GIS hosting environments (e.g., ArcGIS Enterprise + Oracle) for performance.
  • Define GIS security best practices, including integration with enterprise identity providers.

Technical Skills

  • ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal, Server, Data Store) in multi-server/data-center deployments.
  • ArcGIS Pro for geodatabase management, spatial analysis, and service publishing.
  • Enterprise geodatabases (ArcGIS with Oracle) for schema design and performance tuning.
  • Publishing and managing map/feature/geoprocessing services for real-time operational use.
  • GIS integration with web/mobile apps via REST/JavaScript APIs.
  • GIS performance optimization (caching, layer optimization).
  • Security concepts (authentication, SSL/TLS, identity integration).

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 8+ years in GIS solution design, with 3–4 years in an architect/lead role.
  • Proven experience in mission-critical GIS environments with strict uptime and performance requirements.
  • Multi-datacenter/DR environment expertise (replication, high availability).
  • Strong collaboration skills with cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent communication and documentation abilities for technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Should Have

  • Data governance standards for GIS (lifecycle, versioning, quality checks).
  • Collaboration with analytics teams for GIS-enabled dashboards and insights.
  • Capacity planning and performance testing for high-load scenarios.
  • Incident reviews and root cause analysis for GIS issues.
  • Backup/restore strategies aligned with enterprise RPO/RTO objectives.

Technical Skills (Should Have)

  • Real-time GIS components (GeoEvent Server) for streaming data (vehicle locations, sensors).
  • Scripting/automation (Python, ArcPy, PowerShell) for GIS administration and data processing.
  • Integration with message buses (Kafka, ActiveMQ) for real-time workflows.
  • Load balancing/clustering for GIS servers and web tiers.

Secondary Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Advanced GIS analytics/big data processing (heatmaps, clustering).
  • Open-source GIS tools (QGIS, PostGIS, GeoServer).
  • 3D GIS, indoor mapping, or advanced visualization.
  • Integration with BI tools (data warehouses, visualization platforms).

Application Instructions

Interested candidates should email their resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com with notice period, current/expected CTC details. Warning: Reflections Info Systems does not charge fees for job applications. All communications are via official email or LinkedIn. Report suspicious activity to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com.
